DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: ARSIOLI, Bruno Sversut;Arsioli, B.;ARSIOLI, BRUNO;ARSIOLI, B;Bruno Arsioli;B. Arsioli;{Arsioli}, B.;Arsioli

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Bruno Sversut Arsioli. Astrophysics with focus to Multimessenger & Multifrequency aspects of Active Galactic Nuclei (AGNs) and Blazars. Very High Energy, Data Analysis & Machine Learning topics, applied to source discovery and the study of AGN-blazars population properties. &#10;&#10;PostDoc FAPESP fellowship at Gleb Wataghin Physics Institute, State University of Campinas, IFGW Unicamp. &#10;&#10;Pos-Doc at Space Science Data Center (SSDC-ASI) within Italian Space Agency & La Sapienza University of Rome, with Cincia sem Fronteiras fellowship. &#10;&#10;PhD in Relativistic Astrophysics within the International Relativistic Astrophysics PhD Program (IRAP-ErasmusMundus), La Sapienza University of Rome (Dec. 2014). Thesis Title: Multi-frequency data from Active Galactic Nuclei - Blazars. &#10;&#10;Msc. in Nuclear Fusion, Max-Planck-Institut fur Plasmaphysik, within the ErasmusMundus Fusion-EP Program coordinated by Universiteit Gent (Sep. 2010). Thesis Title: Calculation of Neutral Beam Injection Power Deposition for He Plasmas in ASDEX Upgrade. &#10;&#10;Msc. in Physics, IFGW Unicamp (2011). Thesis Title: Studding Tokamak Plasmas: Determination of Ionic Temperature via Vacuum Ultraviolet Spectroscopy, and Plasma Heating using Neutral Beam Injection (NBI).&#10;&#10;Bachelor in Chemistry Engineering, FEQ-Unicamp (Dec. 2006)

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: International Center for Relativistic Astrophysics Network

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract:&#10;&#10;Blazars are the dominant type of extragalactic sources at microwave, hard X-ray, and &#947;-ray energies. In the most energetic part of the electromagnetic spectrum (E > 100 GeV) a large fraction of high Galactic latitude sources are blazars of the High Synchrotron peaked (HSP) type, that is BL Lac objects with synchrotron emission peaking in the UV or in the X-ray band. Building new large samples of HSP blazars is key to understand the properties of jets under extreme conditions, and to study the demographics and the peculiar cosmological evolution of these sources.&#10;&#10;HSP blazars are remarkably rare, with only a few hundreds of them expected to be above the sensitivity limits of currently available surveys. To find these very uncommon sources, we have devised a method that combines WISE all sky survey data with multi-frequency selection criteria.&#10;&#10;The sample was defined starting from a primary list of infrared colour-colour selected sources from the WISE all sky survey database, and applying further restrictions on IR-radio and IR-X-ray flux ratios. Using a polynomial fit to the multi-frequency data we estimated synchrotron peak frequencies and fluxes.&#10;&#10;We assembled the largest existing list of confirmed and candidates HSP blazars. All 711 objects in the sample are expected to radiate up to the highest &#947;-ray photon energies. In fact, 249 of these sources are confirmed emitters of GeV &#947;-ray photons (based on Fermi-LAT catalogues), and 32 have already been detected in the TeV band. Probably all sources in the sample are within reach of the upcoming Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA), and many may already be detectable by the current generation of Cherenkov telescopes during flaring episodes.&#10;&#10;The sample includes 364 previously known objects, 71 new identifications and 278 HSP candidates (for which no optical spectra is available yet).&#10;&#10;The present work represents a significant improvement compared to the Sedentary survey, the previously l

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Participation at the discovery of the first extragalactic neutrino source, the blazar TXS 0506+056. Worked to describe TXS 0506+056 and PKS 0502+049 in &#947;-rays, with light curves, Test Statistical (TS) maps, likelihood & high-energy spectral analysis.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produo e Distribuio de Eletricidade e Gs

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Estudo que aborda as diversas tecnologias de produo, armazenamento e distribuio do hidrgnio, e os equipamentos necessrios a sua utilizao como vetor energtico; Abordagem sobre os diversos tipos de Clulas a Combustvel. Dentre as tecnologias abordadas esto: o aproveitamento da energia solar para produo de hidrognio atravs de processo de eletrolise da gua e processo biolgico ( algas ); Energia nuclear para produo atravs do craqueamento trmico e eletrlise da gua; Reforma de biocombustveis;

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Relatrio contm medidas de temperatura atomica e ionica do hidrognio e impurezas que compe o plasma gerado nas descargas do Tokamak Nova-Unicamp. Aborda parametros necessrios calibrao dos equipamentos, montagem do aparato optico e conceitos bsicos de operao da mquina.
